panels.description: Ratio of failed request in the past hour
panels.title: Hourly Error rate

panels.description: Ratio of failed NTP request in the past day
panels.title: Daily Error Rate

panels.description: Amount of errors in the past 15 minutes / Amount of total "probe" NTP requests. If you see nothing there were no errors :)
panels.title: Error rate (15m)

panels.description: Total "probe" NTP requests and errors (timeout or otherwise)
panels.title: Monitoring probes

panels.description: Average offset over the selected range
panels.title: Average Offset Over Time

panels.description: Estimated offset in nanoseconds compared to our local clock
panels.title: Offset Over Time

panels.description: Offset in microseconds (10^6e seconds or 1000 nanoseconds), in buckets of 10 microseconds.
panels.title: Offset Histogram

panels.description: Estimate of the Round Trip Time in milliseconds between us and the server
panels.title: Round Trip Time

panels.description: Overview of how many samples fell between ranges of Round Trip Times.
panels.title: Round Trip Time Histogram

panels.description: Indication of whether a leap second should be inserted at the end of this month.
panels.title: Leap Second Indicator

panels.description: The server's estimate of the maximum error relative to the reference clock (not reported by all servers)
panels.title: Root Dispersion

panels.description: An estimate of the distance between the client and the stratum 1 server
panels.title: Root Distance

panels.description: The server's agregate round-trip delay to the stratum 1 server. Some stratum 1 servers will fill this in with their estimation of the delay to their refclock.
panels.title: Root Delay

panels.description: Server's reported precision in nanoseconds. Not all servers might reliably report this.
panels.title: Precision

panels.description: Estimated minimum bound on the error between the local clock and the server clock.
panels.title: Minimum Clock Error
